summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The Parables of Solomon the son of David king of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To know wisdom, and instruction, to understand the words of knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To receive instruction to do wisely, by justice and judgment and equity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To give unto the simple sharpness of wit, and to the child knowledge and discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wise man shall hear and increase in learning, and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To understand a parable, and the interpretation, the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, hear thy father’s instruction, and forsake not thy mother’s teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they shall be a comely ornament unto thine head, and as chains for thy neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if sinners do entice thee, consent thou not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they say, Come with us, we will lay wait for blood, and lie privily for the innocent without a cause:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will swallow them up alive like a grave, even whole, as those that go down into the pit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We shall find all precious riches, and fill our houses with spoil:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast in thy lot among us, we will all have one purse:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, walk not thou in the way with them: refrain thy foot from their path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly as without cause the net is spread before the eyes of all that hath wing:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they lay wait for blood, and lie privily for their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such are the ways of everyone that is greedy of gain: he would take away the life of the owners thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom crieth without: she uttereth her voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She calleth in the high street, among the prease in the enterings of the gates, and uttereth her words in the city, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O ye foolish, how long will ye love foolishness? and the scornful take their pleasure in scorning? and the fools hate knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Turn you at my correction: lo, I will pour out my mind unto you, and make you understand my words.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I have called, and ye refused: I have stretched out mine hand, and none would regard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye have despised all my counsel, and would none of my correction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also laugh at your destruction, and mock when your fear cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your fear cometh like sudden desolation, and your destruction shall come like a whirlwind: when affliction and anguish shall come upon you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer: they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would none of my counsel, but despised all my correction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ease slayeth the foolish, and the prosperity of fools destroyeth them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that obeyeth me, shall dwell safely, and be quiet from fear of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments within thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cause thine ears to hearken unto wisdom, and incline thine heart to understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For if thou callest after knowledge, and cryest for understanding:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for treasures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord giveth wisdom, out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He preserveth the state of the righteous, he is a shield to them that walk uprightly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That they may keep the ways of judgment: and he preserveth the way of his Saints).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness and judgment, and equity, and every good path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge delighteth thy soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall counsel preserve thee, and understanding shall keep thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And deliver thee from the evil way, and from the man that speaketh froward things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from them that leave the ways of righteousness to walk in the ways of darkness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which rejoice in doing evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whose ways are crooked, and they are lewd in their paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely her house tendeth to death, and her paths unto the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All they that go unto her, return not again, neither take they hold of the ways of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore walk thou in the way of good men, and keep the ways of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the just shall dwell in the land, and the upright men shall remain in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressor shall be rooted out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, forget not thou my Law, but let thine heart keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they shall increase the length of thy days and the years of life, and thy prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them on thy neck, and write them upon the table of thine heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shalt thou find favor and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart, and lean not unto thine own wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes: but fear the Lord, and depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So health shall be unto thy navel, and marrow unto thy bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor the Lord with thy riches, and with the first fruits of all thine increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall thy barns be filled with abundance, and thy presses shall burst with new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, refuse not the chastening of the Lord, neither be grieved with his correction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord correcteth him, whom he loveth, even as the father doth the child, in whom he delighteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the merchandise thereof is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof is better than gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is more precious than pearls: and all things that thou canst desire, are not to be compared unto her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Length of days is in her right hand, and in her right hand riches and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her ways are ways of pleasure, and all her paths prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold on her, and blessed is he that retaineth her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord by wisdom hath laid the foundation of the earth, and hath stablished the heavens through understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, let not these things depart from thine eyes, but observe wisdom and counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall be life to thy soul, and grace unto thy neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou walk safely by the way: and thy foot shall not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou sleepest, thou shalt not be afraid: and when thou sleepest, thy sleep shall be sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not fear for any sudden fear, neither for destruction of the wicked, when it cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord shall be for thine assurance, and shall preserve thy foot from taking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Withhold not the good from the owners thereof, though there be power in [thine] hand to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say not unto thy neighbor, Go and come again, and tomorrow will I give thee, if thou now have it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Intend none hurt against thy neighbor, seeing he doth dwell without fear by thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strive not with a man causeless, when he hath done thee no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not envious for the wicked man, neither choose any of his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the froward is abomination unto the Lord: but his secret is with the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the scornful he scorneth, but he giveth grace unto the humble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise shall inherit glory: but fools dishonor, though they be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, O ye children, the instruction of a father, and give ear to learn understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do give you a good doctrine: therefore forsake ye not my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was my father’s son, tender and dear in the sight of my mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he taught me, and said unto me, Let thine heart hold fast my words: keep my commandments, and thou shalt live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get wisdom: get understanding: forget not, neither decline from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forsake her not, and she shall keep thee: love her and she shall preserve thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is the beginning: get wisdom therefore: and above all thy possession get understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exalt her, and she shall exalt thee: she shall bring thee to honor, if thou embrace her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She shall give a comely ornament unto thine head, yea, she shall give thee a crown of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, my son: and receive my words, and the years of thy life shall be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom, and led thee in the paths of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou goest, thy gait shall not be strait, and when thou runnest, thou shalt not fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take hold of instruction, and leave not: keep her, for she is thy life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enter not into the way of the wicked, and walk not in the way of evil men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Avoid it, and go not by it: turn from it, and pass by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they cannot sleep, except they have done evil, and their sleep departeth except they cause some to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the way of the righteous shineth as the light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of the wicked is as the darkness: they know not wherein they shall fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, hearken unto my words, incline thine ear unto my sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them not depart from thine eyes, but keep them in the midst of thine heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are life unto those that find them: and health unto all their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep thine heart with all diligence: for thereout cometh life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and put wicked lips far from thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let thine eyes behold the right, and let thine eyelids direct thy way before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be ordered aright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn not to the right hand, nor to the left, but remove thy foot from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, hearken unto my wisdom, and incline thine ear unto my knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That thou mayest regard counsel, and thy lips observe knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is more soft than oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the end of her is bitter as wormwood, and sharp as a two-edged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her feet go down to death, and her steps take hold on hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She weigheth not the way of life: her paths are moveable: thou canst not know them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear ye me now therefore, O children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep thy way far from her, and come not near the door of her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest thou give thine honor unto others, and thy years to the cruel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest the stranger should be filled with thy strength, and thy labors be in the house of a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou mourn at thine end, (when thou hast consumed thy flesh and thy body)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say, How have I hated instruction, and mine heart despised correction!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And have not obeyed the voice of them that taught me, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was almost brought into all evil in the midst of the Congregation and assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Drink the water of thy cistern, and of the rivers out of the midst of thine own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let thy fountains flow forth, and the rivers of waters in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let them be thine, even thine only, and not the strangers with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let thy fountain be blessed, and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe: let her breasts satisfy thee at all times, and delight in her love continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For why shouldest thou delight, my son, in a strange woman, or embrace the bosom of a stranger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord, and he pondereth all his paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall die for fault of instruction, and shall go astray through his great folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if thou be surety for thy neighbor, and hast stricken hands with the stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth: thou art even taken with the words of thine own mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this now, my Son, and deliver thyself: seeing thou art come into the hand of thy neighbor, go, and humble thyself, and solicit thy friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give no sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deliver thyself as a Doe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the pismire, O sluggard: behold her ways, and be wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she having no guide, governor, nor ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prepareth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of the sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thy poverty cometh as one that traveleth by the way, and thy necessity like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The unthrifty man and the wicked man walketh with a froward mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He maketh a sign with his eyes: he signifieth with his feet: he instructeth with his fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lewd things are in his heart: he imagineth evil at all times, and raiseth up contentions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore shall his destruction come speedily: he shall be destroyed suddenly without recovery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These six things doth the Lord hate: yea, his soul abhorreth seven:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and the hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An heart that imagineth wicked enterprises, feet that be swift in running to mischief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false witness that speaketh lies, and him that raiseth up contentions among brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not thy mother’s instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bind them always upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall lead thee when thou walkest: it shall watch for thee when thou sleepest, and when thou wakest, it shall talk with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the commandment is a lantern, and instruction a light: and corrections for instruction are the way of life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To keep thee from the wicked woman, and from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Desire not her beauty in thine heart, neither let her take thee with her eye lids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For because of the whorish woman, a man is brought to a morsel of bread, and a woman will hunt for the precious life of a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burnt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or can a man go upon coals, and his feet not be burnt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he that goeth into his neighbor’s wife, shall not be innocent, whosoever toucheth her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men do not despise a thief, when he stealeth to satisfy his soul, because he is hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold, or he shall give all the substance of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that commiteth adultery with a woman, he is destitute of understanding: he that doeth it, destroyeth his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall find a wound and dishonor, and his reproach shall never be put away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cannot bear the sight of any ransom: neither will he consent, though thou augment the gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son keep my words, and hide my commandments with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep my commandments, and thou shalt live, and mine instruction, as the apple of thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bind them upon thy fingers, and write them upon the table of thine heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister, and call understanding thy kinswoman,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, even from the strange that is smooth in her words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I was in the window of mine house, I looked through my window,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw among the fools, and considered among the children a young man destitute of understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who passed through the street by her corner, and went toward her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twilight in the evening, when the night began to be black and dark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there met him a woman with an harlot’s behavior, and subtle in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (She is babbling and loud, whose feet cannot abide in her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now she is without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she caught him and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have peace offerings: this day have I paid my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, that I might seek thy face: and I have found thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have decked my bed with ornaments, carpets and laces of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us take our pleasure in dalliance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For mine husband is not at home: he is gone a journey far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath taken with him a bag of silver, and will come home at the day appointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus with her great craft she caused him to yield, and with her flattering lips she enticed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he followed her straightway, as an ox that goeth to the slaughter, and as a fool to the stocks for correction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Till a dart strike through his liver, as a bird hasteth to the snare, not knowing that he is in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear me now therefore, O children, and hearken to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let not thine heart decline to her ways: wander thou not in her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she hath caused many to fall down wounded, and the strong men are all slain by her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her house is the way unto the grave, which goeth down to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding utter her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She standeth in the top of the high places, by the way in the place of the paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She crieth besides the gates before the city at the entry of the doors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O men, I call unto you, and utter my voice to the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O ye foolish men, understand wisdom, and ye, O fools, be wise in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give ear, for I will speak of excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall teach things that be right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my mouth shall speak the truth, and my lips abhor wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the words of my mouth are righteous: there is no lewdness, nor frowardness in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are all plain to them that will understand, and straight to them that would find knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Receive mine instruction, and not silver, and knowledge rather than fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wisdom is better than precious stones: and all pleasures are not to be compared unto her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and I find forth knowledge and counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is to hate evil, as pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way: and a mouth that speaketh lewd things I do hate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have counsel and wisdom: I am understanding, and I have strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By me princes rule, and the nobles, and all the judges of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I love them that love me: and they that seek me early shall find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Riches and honor are with me: even durable riches and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My fruit is better than gold, even than fine gold, and my revenues better than fine silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I cause to walk in the way of righteousness, and in the midst of the paths of judgment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That I may cause them that love me, to inherit substance, and I will fill their treasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hath possessed me in the beginning of his way: I was before his works of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, and before the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When there were no depths, was I begotten, when there were no fountains abounding with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the mountains were settled: and before the hills, was I begotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had not yet made the earth, nor the open places, nor the height of the dust in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he prepared the heavens, I was there, when he set the compass upon the deep:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he established the clouds above: when he confirmed the fountains of the deep:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he gave his decree to the sea, that the waters should not pass his commandment, when he appointed the foundations of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was I with him as a nourisher, and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And took my solace in the compass of his earth: and my delight is with the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now hearken, O children, unto me: for blessed are they that keep my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear instruction, and be ye wise, and refuse it not: blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, and giving attendance at the posts of my doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that findeth me, findeth life, and shall obtain favor of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that sinneth against me, hurteth his own soul: and all that hate me, love death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom hath built her house, and hewn out her seven pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She hath killed her victuals, drawn her wine, and prepared her table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She hath sent forth her maidens, and crieth upon the highest places of the city, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who so is simple, let him come hither, and to him that is destitute of wisdom, she saith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, and eat of my meat, and drink of the wine that I have drawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forsake your way, ye foolish, and ye shall live: and walk in the way of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that reproveth a scorner, purchaseth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh the wicked, getteth himself a blot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebuke not a scorner, lest he hate thee: but rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give admonition to the wise, and he will be the wiser: teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the Lord, and the knowledge of holy things, is understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy days shall be multiplied by me, and the years of thy life shall be augmented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself, and if thou be a scorner, thou alone shalt suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A foolish woman is troublesome; she is ignorant and knoweth nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she sitteth at the door of her house on a seat in the high places of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To call them that pass by the way, that go right on their way, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who so is simple let him come hither, and to him that is destitute of wisdom, she saith also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stolen waters are sweet, and hid bread is pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knoweth not, that the dead are there, and that her guests are in the depth of hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is an heaviness to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will not famish the soul of the righteous: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A slothful hand maketh poor: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that gathereth in summer, is the son of wisdom: but he that sleepeth in harvest, is the son of confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessings are upon the head of the righteous: but iniquity shall cover the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The memorial of the just shall be blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but the foolish in talk shall be beaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh uprightly, walketh boldly: but he that perverteth his ways, shall be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that winketh with the eye, worketh sorrow, and he that is foolish in talk, shall be beaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mouth of a righteous man is a wellspring of life: but iniquity covereth the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hatred stirreth up contentions: but love covereth all trespasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the lips of him that hath understanding, wisdom is found, and a rod shall be for the back of him that is destitute of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the fool is a present destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man’s goods are his strong city: but the fear of the needy is their poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The labor of the righteous tendeth to life: but the revenues of the wicked to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that regardeth instruction is in the way of life: but he that refuseth correction, goeth out of the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that dissembleth hatred with lying lips, and he that inventeth slander, is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In many words there cannot want iniquity: but he that refraineth his lips, is wise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tongue of the just man is as fined silver: but the heart of the wicked is little worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of the righteous do feed many: but fools shall die for want of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he doth add no sorrows with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a pastime to a fool to do wickedly: but wisdom is understanding to a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which the wicked feareth, shall come upon him: but God will grant the desire of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is as an everlasting foundation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As vinegar is to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the slothful to them that send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord increaseth the days: but the years of the wicked shall be diminished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The patient abiding of the righteous shall be gladness: but the hope of the wicked shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of the Lord is strength to the upright man: but fear shall be for the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not dwell in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mouth of the just shall be fruitful in wisdom: but the tongue of the froward shall be cut out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh froward things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: False balances are an abomination unto the Lord: but a perfect weight pleaseth him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The uprightness of the just shall guide them: but the frowardness of the transgressors shall destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Riches avail not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteousness of the upright shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall in his own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteousness of the just shall deliver them: but the transgressors shall be taken in their own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a wicked man dieth, his hope perisheth, and the hope of the unjust shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous escapeth out of trouble, and the wicked shall come in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An hypocrite with his mouth hurteth his neighbor: but the righteous shall be delivered by knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the prosperity of the righteous the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the blessing of the righteous the city is exalted: but it is subverted by the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that despiseth his neighbor, is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding will keep silence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that goeth about as a slanderer, discovereth a secret: but he that is of a faithful heart, concealeth a matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but where many counselors are, there is health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be sore vexed, that is surety for a stranger, and he that hateth suretiship, is sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A gracious woman attaineth honor, and the strong men attain riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is merciful, rewardeth his own soul: but he that troubleth his own flesh, is cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but he that soweth righteousness, shall receive a sure reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As righteousness leadeth to life: so he that followeth evil, seeketh his own death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that are of a froward heart, are abomination to the Lord: but they that are upright in their way, are his delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout: so is a fair woman which lacketh discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the hope of the wicked is indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is that scattereth, and is more increased: but he that spareth more than is right, surely cometh to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The liberal person shall have plenty: and he that watereth, shall also have rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that withdraweth the corn, the people will curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth corn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that seeketh good things getteth favor: but he that seeketh evil, it shall come to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that trusteth in his riches, shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a leaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that troubleth his own house, shall inherit the wind, and the fool shall be servant to the wise in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fruit of the righteous is as a tree of life, and he that winneth souls is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: how much more the wicked and the sinner?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that loveth instruction, loveth knowledge: but he that hateth correction, is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good man getteth favor of the Lord: but the man of wicked imaginations will he condemn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man cannot be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A virtuous woman is the crown of her husband: but she that maketh him ashamed, is as corruption in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thoughts of the just are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The talking of the wicked is to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the righteous will deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God overthroweth the wicked, and they are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man shall be commended for his wisdom: but the froward of heart shall be despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is despised, and is his own servant, is better than he that boasteth himself, and lacketh bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the mercies of the wicked are cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that tilleth his land, shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth the idle, is destitute of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked desireth the net of evils: but the root of the righteous giveth fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The evil man is snared by the wickedness of his lips, but the just shall come out of adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man shall be satiate with good things by the fruit of his mouth, and the recompense of a man’s hands shall God give unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that heareth in counsel, is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool in a day shall be known by his anger: but he that covereth shame, is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that speaketh truth, will show righteousness: but a false witness useth deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is that speaketh words like the prickings of a sword: but the tongue of wise men is health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lip of truth shall be stable forever: but a lying tongue varieth incontinently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counselors of peace shall be joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall none iniquity come to the just: but the wicked are full of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lying lips are an abomination to the Lord: but they that deal truly are his delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of the fools publisheth foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the idle shall be under tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaviness in the heart of man doth bring it down: but a good word rejoice it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous is more excellent than his neighbor: but the way of the wicked will deceive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The deceitful man roasteth not that he took in hunting: but the riches of the diligent man are precious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Life is in the way of righteousness, and in that pathway there is no death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise son will obey the instruction of his father: but a scorner will hear no rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man shall eat good things by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the trespasser shall suffer violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that keepeth his mouth, keepeth his life: but he that openeth his lips, destruction shall be to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sluggard lusteth, but his soul hath nought: but the soul of the diligent shall have plenty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A righteous man hateth lying words: but the wicked causeth slander and shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteousness preserveth the upright of life: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is that maketh himself rich, and hath nothing, and that maketh himself poor, having great riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man will give his riches for the ransom of his life: but the poor cannot hear the reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the candle of the wicked shall be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only by pride doth man make contention: but with the well-advised is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The riches of vanity shall diminish: but he that gathereth with the hand, shall increase them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hope that is deferred, is the fainting of the heart, but when the desire cometh, it is as a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that despiseth the word, he shall be destroyed, but he that feareth the commandment, he shall be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The instruction of a wise man is as the wellspring of life, to turn away from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Good understanding maketh acceptable: but the way of the disobedient is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every wise man will work by knowledge: but a fool will spread abroad folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked messenger falleth into evil: but a faithful ambassador is preservation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Poverty and shame is to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth correction, shall be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A desire accomplished, delighteth the soul: but it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh with the wise shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Affliction followeth sinners: but unto the righteous, God will recompense good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good man shall give inheritance unto his children’s children: and the riches of the sinner is laid up for the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Much food is in the field of the poor, but the field is destroyed without discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that spareth his rod, hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous eateth to the contentation of his mind: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish destroyeth it with her own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh in his righteousness, feareth the Lord: but he that is lewd in his ways, despiseth him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the mouth of the foolish is the rod of pride: but the lips of the wise preserve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where none oxen are, there the crib is empty: but much increase cometh by the strength of the ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false record will speak lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy to him that will understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Depart from the foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the foolishness of the fools is deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fool maketh a mock of sin: but among the righteous there is favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart knoweth the bitterness of his soul, and the stranger shall not meddle with his joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house of the wicked shall be destroyed: but the tabernacle of the righteous shall flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a way that seemeth right to a man: but the issues thereof are the ways of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even in laughing the heart is sorrowful, and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart that declineth, shall be satiated with his own ways: but a good man shall depart from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolish will believe everything: but the prudent will consider his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil, but a fool rageth, and is careless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is hasty to anger, commiteth folly, and a busybody is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolish do inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The evil shall bow before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor is hated even of his own neighbor: but the friends of the rich are many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sinner despiseth his neighbor: but he that hath mercy on the poor, is blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not they err that imagine evil? but to them that think on good things, shall be mercy and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all labor there is abundance: but the talk of the lips bringeth only want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crown of the wise is their riches, and the folly of fools is foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A faithful witness delivereth souls: but a deceiver speaketh lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fear of the Lord is an assured strength, and his children shall have hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is as a wellspring of life, to avoid the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the multitude of the people is the honor of a King, and for the want of people cometh the destruction of the Prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is slow to wrath, is of great wisdom: but he that is of an hasty mind, exalteth folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy is the rotting of the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that oppresseth the poor, reproveth him that made him: but he honoreth him, that hath mercy on the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked shall be cast away for his malice: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding, and is known in the midst of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Justice exalteth a nation, but sin is a shame to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pleasure of a King is in a wise servant: but his wrath shall be toward him that is lewd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A soft answer putteth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools babbleth out foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eyes of the Lord in every place behold the evil and the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wholesome tongue is as a tree of life: but the frowardness thereof is the breaking of the mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool despiseth his father’s instruction, but he that regardeth correction, is prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house of the righteous hath much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of the wise do spread abroad knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doth not so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination unto the Lord: but the prayer of the righteous is acceptable unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the Lord: but he loveth him that followeth righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instruction is evil to him that forsaketh the way, and he that hateth correction, shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hell and destruction are before the Lord, how much more the hearts of the sons of men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A scorner loveth not him that rebuketh him, neither will he go unto the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A joyful heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by the sorrow of the heart the mind is heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of him that hath understanding, seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of the fool is fed with foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of the afflicted are evil; but a good conscience is a continual feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is a little with the fear of the Lord, than great treasure and trouble therewith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is a dinner of green herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angry man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to wrath, appeaseth strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of a slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is plain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise son rejoiceth the father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foolishness is joy to him that is destitute of understanding: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without counsel, thoughts come to nought: but in the multitude of counselors there is steadfastness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A joy cometh to a man by the answer of his mouth: and how good is a word in due season?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of life is on high to the prudent, to avoid from hell beneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will destroy the house of the proud men: but he will stablish the borders of the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thoughts of the wicked are abomination to the Lord: but the pure have pleasant words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is greedy of gain, troubleth his own house: but he that beareth gifts, shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the wicked man’s mouth babbleth evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is far off from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart, and a good name maketh the bones fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ear that hearkeneth to the correction of life, shall lodge among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that refuseth instruction, despiseth his own soul: but he that obeyeth correction, getteth understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom: and before honor goeth humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The preparations of the heart are in man: but the answer of the tongue is of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes: but the Lord pondereth the spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be directed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hath made all things for his own sake: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that are proud in heart, are an abomination to the Lord: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By mercy and truth iniquity shall be forgiven, and by the fear of the Lord they depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ways of a man please the Lord, he will make also his enemies at peace with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is a little with righteousness, than great revenues without equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of man purposeth his way: but the Lord doth direct his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A divine sentence shall be in the lips of the king: his mouth shall not transgress in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A true weight and balance are of the Lord: and the weights of the bag are his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is stablished by justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings, and the king loveth him that speaketh right things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the light of the king’s countenance is life: and his favor is as a cloud of the latter rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold? and to get understanding, is more to be desired than silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The path of the righteous is to decline from evil, and he keepeth his soul that keepeth his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pride goeth before destruction, and an high mind before the fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better it is to be of humble mind with the lowly, than to divide the spoils with the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is wise in his business, shall find good: and he that trusteth in the Lord, he is blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise in heart shall be called prudent and the sweetness of the lips shall increase doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto them that have it: and the instruction of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of the wise guideth his mouth wisely, and addeth doctrine to his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fair words are as an honey comb, sweetness to the soul, and health to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a way that seemeth right unto man, but the issue thereof are the ways of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person that travaileth, travaileth for himself: for his mouth craveth it of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked man diggeth up evil, and in his lips is like burning fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A froward person soweth strife: and a taleteller maketh division among princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked man deceiveth his neighbor, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shutteth his eyes to devise wickedness: he moveth his lips, and bringeth evil to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Age is a crown of glory, when it is found in the way of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is slow unto anger, is better than the mighty man: and he that ruleth his own mind, is better than he that winneth a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot is cast into the lap: but the whole disposition thereof is of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is a dry morsel, if peace be with it, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A discrete servant shall have rule over a lewd son, and he shall divide the heritage among the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As is the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold, so the Lord trieth the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked giveth heed to false lips, and a liar hearkeneth to the naughty tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that mocketh the poor, reproacheth him that made him: and he that rejoiceth at destruction, shall not be unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children’s children are the crown of the elders: and the glory of the children are their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: High talk becometh not a fool, much less a lying talk a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A reward is as a stone pleasant in the eyes of them that have it: it prospereth, whithersoever it turneth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that covereth a transgression, seeketh love: but he that repeateth a matter, separateth the prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A reproof entereth more into him that hath understanding, than an hundred stripes into a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A seditious person seeketh only evil, and a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better for a man to meet a bear robbed of her whelps, than a fool in his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beginning of strife is as one that openeth the waters: therefore, or the contention be meddled with, leave off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of the fool to get wisdom, and he hath none heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A friend loveth at all times; and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man destitute of understanding, toucheth the hand, and becometh surety for his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate, seeketh destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a naughty tongue, shall fall into evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that begetteth a fool, getteth himself sorrow, and the father of a fool can have no joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A joyful heart causeth good health: but a sorrowful mind drieth the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to wrest the ways of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is in the face of him that hath understanding: but the eyes of a fool are in the corners of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A foolish son is a grief unto his father, and a heaviness to her that bare him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely it is not good to condemn the just, nor that the princes should smite such for equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath knowledge, spareth his words, and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even a fool, (when he holdeth his peace) is counted wise, and he that stoppeth his lips, prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the desire thereof he will separate himself to seek it, and occupy himself in all wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool hath no delight in understanding: but that his heart may be discovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wicked cometh, then cometh contempt, and with the vile man reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of a man’s mouth are like deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom is like a flowing river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to cause the righteous to fall in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool’s lips come with strife, and his mouth calleth for stripes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool’s mouth is his own destruction, and his lips are a snare for his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of a talebearer are as flatterings, and they go down into the bowels of the belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also that is slothful in his work, is even the brother of him that is a great waster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth unto it, and is exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man’s riches are his strong city: and as an high wall in his imagination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before destruction the heart of a man is haughty, and before glory goeth lowliness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that answereth a matter before he hear it, it is folly and shame unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity: but a wounded spirit, who can bear it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise heart getteth knowledge, and the ear of the wise seeketh learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man’s gift enlargeth him, and leadeth him before great men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is first in his own cause, is just: then cometh his neighbor and maketh inquiry of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and maketh a partition among the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A brother offended is harder to win than a strong city, and their contentions are like the bar of a palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the fruit of a man’s mouth shall his belly be satisfied, and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and they that love it, shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that findeth a wife, findeth a good thing, and receiveth favor of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor speaketh with prayers: but the rich answereth roughly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that hath friends, ought to show himself friendly: for a friend is nearer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that abuseth his lips, and is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For without knowledge the mind is not good, and he that hasteth with his feet, sinneth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolishness of a man perverteth his way, and his heart fretteth against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Riches gather many friends: but the poor is separated from his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished: and he that speaketh lies, shall not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many reverence the face of the prince, and every man is friend to him that giveth gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more will his friends depart far from him? though he be instant with words, yet they will not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that possesseth understanding, loveth his own soul, and keepeth wisdom to find goodness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished: and he that speaketh lies, shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pleasure is not comely for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The discretion of man deferreth his anger: and his glory is to pass by an offence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king’s wrath is like the roaring of a lion: but his favor is like the dew upon the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father, and the contentions of a wife are like a continual dropping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: House and riches are the inheritance of the fathers: but a prudent wife cometh of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slothfulness causeth to fall asleep, and a deceitful person shall be affamished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that keepeth the commandment, keepeth his own soul: but he that despiseth his ways, shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath mercy upon the poor, lendeth unto the Lord: and the Lord will recompense him that which he hath given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his murmuring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man of much anger shall suffer punishment, and though thou deliver him, yet will his anger come again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear counsel and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many devices are in a man’s heart: but the counsel of the Lord shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That that is to be desired of a man, is his goodness, and a poor man is better than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord leadeth to life: and he that is filled therewith, shall continue, and shall not be visited with evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not put it to his mouth again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Smite a scorner, and the foolish will beware: and reprove the prudent, and he will understand knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that destroyeth his father, or chaseth away his mother, is a lewd and shameful child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, hear no more the instruction, that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked witness mocketh at judgment, and the mouth of the wicked swalloweth up iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But judgments are prepared for the scorners, and stripes for the back of the fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wine is a mocker, and strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby, is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the King is like the roaring of a lion: he that provoketh him unto anger sinneth against his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a man’s honor to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful will not plow, because of winter: therefore shall he beg in summer, but have nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The counsel in the heart of man is like deep waters: but a man that hath understanding, will draw it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many men will boast every one of his own goodness: but who can find a faithful man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh in his integrity, is just, and blessed shall his children be after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment, chaseth away all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can say, I have made mine heart clean, I am clean from my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Divers weights, and divers measures, both these are even abomination unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A child also is known by his doings, whether his word be pure and right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hath made both these, even the ear to hear, and the eye to see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love not sleep, lest thou come unto poverty: open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone apart, he boasteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is gold, and a multitude of precious stones: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take his garment, that is surety for a stranger, and a pledge of him for the stranger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bread of deceit is sweet to a man: but afterward his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Establish thy thoughts by counsel; and by counsel make war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that goeth about as a slanderer, discovereth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that curseth his father or his mother, his light shall be put out in obscure darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An heritage is hastily gotten at the beginning, but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say not thou, I will recompense evil, but wait upon the Lord, and he shall save thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Diverse weights are an abomination unto the Lord, and deceitful balances are not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The steps of man are ruled by the Lord: how can a man then understand his own way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a destruction for a man to devour that which is sanctified, and after the vows to inquire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise King scattereth the wicked, and causeth the wheel to turn over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the Lord is the breath of man, and searcheth all the bowels of the belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mercy and truth preserve the king: for his throne shall be established with mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beauty of young men is their strength, and the glory of the aged is the gray head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blueness of the wound serveth to purge the evil, and the stripes within the bowels of the belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The King’s heart is in the hand of the Lord, as the rivers of waters: he turneth it whithersoever it pleaseth him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the Lord pondereth the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A haughty look, and a proud heart which is the light of the wicked, is sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thoughts of the diligent do surely bring abundance; but whosoever is hasty, cometh surely to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gathering of treasures by a deceitful tongue, is vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; for they have refused to execute judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of some is perverted and strange, but of the pure man, his work is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the house top, than with a contentious woman in a wide house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soul of the wicked wisheth evil, and his neighbor hath no favor in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the scorner is punished, the foolish is wise, and when one instructeth the wise, he will receive knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous teacheth the house of the wicked; but God overthroweth the wicked for their evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that stoppeth his ear at the crying of the poor, he shall also cry and not be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a gift in the bosom, great wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is joy to the just to do judgment; but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that wandereth out of the way of wisdom, shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that loveth pastime, shall be a poor man; and he that loveth wine and oil, shall not be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked shall be a ransom for the just, and the transgressor for the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and angry woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the house of the wise is a pleasant treasure and oil; but a foolish man devoureth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy, shall find life, righteousness and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man goeth up into the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that keepeth his mouth and his tongue, keepeth his soul from afflictions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Proud, haughty, and scornful is his name that worketh in his arrogancy wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The desire of the slothful slayeth him; for his hands refuse to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He coveteth evermore greedily: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination: how much more when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false witness shall perish: but he that heareth, speaketh continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked man hardeneth his face: but the just, he will direct his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no wisdom, neither understanding, nor counsel against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but salvation is of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good name is to be chosen above great riches, and loving favor is above silver and above gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich and poor meet together, the Lord is the maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prudent man seeth the plague, and hideth himself: but the foolish go on still, and are punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The reward of humility, and the fear of God is riches, and glory, and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: but he that regardeth his soul, will depart far from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach a child in the trade of his way, and when he is old he shall not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich ruleth the poor, and the borrower is servant to the man that lendeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that soweth iniquity, shall reap affliction, and the rod of his anger shall fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath a good eye, he shall be blessed: for he giveth of his bread unto the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast out the scorner, and strife shall go out: so contention and reproach shall cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that loveth pureness of heart for the grace of his lips, the king shall be his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge: but he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful man saith, A lion is without, I shall be slain in the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mouth of strange women is as a deep pit: he with whom the Lord is angry, shall fall therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child: but the rod of correction shall drive it away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that oppresseth the poor to increase himself, and giveth unto the rich, shall surely come to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it shall be pleasant, if thou keep them in thy belly, and if they be directed together in thy lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator
