verses.text: That thy confidence may be in the Lord, I have showed thee this day: thou therefore take heed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have not I written unto thee three times in counsels and knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That I might show thee the assurance of the words of truth, to answer the words of truth to them that send to thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor, neither oppress the afflicted in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will defend their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoil them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make no friendship with an angry man, neither go with the furious man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest thou learn his ways, and receive destruction to thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not thou of them that tough the hand, nor among them that are surety for debts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou hast nothing to pay, why causest thou that he should take thy bed from under thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not remove the ancient bounds which thy fathers have made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou seest that a diligent man in his business standeth before Kings, and standeth not before the base sort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And put thy knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to the appetite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not desirous of his dainty meats: for it is a deceivable meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Travail not too much to be rich: but cease from thy wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou cast thine eyes upon it, which is nothing? for riches taketh her to her wings, as an Eagle, and flieth into the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire his dainty meats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as though he thought it in his heart: so will he say unto thee, Eat and drink: but his heart is not with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt vomit thy morsel that thou hast eaten, and thou shalt lose thy sweet words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remove not the ancient bounds, and enter not into the fields of the fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that redeemeth them, is mighty: he will defend their cause against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Apply thine heart to instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Withhold not correction from the child: if thou smite him with the rod, he shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt smite him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if thine heart be wise, mine heart shall rejoice, and I also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak righteous things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let not thine heart be envious against sinners: but let it be in the fear of the Lord continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For surely there is an end, and thy hope shall not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O thou my son, hear, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep not company with drunkards, nor with gluttons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the drunkard and the glutton shall be poor, and the sleeper shall be clothed with rags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey thy father that hath begotten thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Buy the truth, but sell it not: likewise wisdom, instruction, and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice, and he that begetteth a wise child, shall have joy of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes delight in my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a whore is as a deep ditch, and a strange woman is as a narrow pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also she lieth in wait as for a prey, and she increaseth the transgressors among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom is woe? to whom is sorrow? to whom is strife? to whom is murmuring? to whom are wounds without cause? and to whom is the redness of the eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even to them that tarry long at the wine, to them that go, and seek mixed wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look not thou upon the wine, when it is red, and when it showeth his color in the cup, or goeth down pleasantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the end thereof it will bite like a serpent, and hurt like a cockatrice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine eyes shall look upon strange women, and thine heart shall speak lewd things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt be as one that sleepeth in the midst of the sea, and as he that sleepeth in the top of the mast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, but I was not sick: they have beaten me, but I knew not, when I awoke: therefore will I seek it yet still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their heart imagineth destruction, and their lips speak mischief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through wisdom is an house built, and with understanding it is established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man is strong: for a man of understanding increaseth his strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For with counsel thou shalt enterprise thy war, and in the multitude of them that can give counsel, is health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is high to a fool: therefore he cannot open his mouth in the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that imagineth to do evil, men shall call him an author of wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked thought of a fool is sin, and the scorner is an abomination unto men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou be faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deliver them that are drawn to death, and wilt thou not preserve them that are led to be slain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou say, Behold, we knew not of it: he that pondereth the hearts, doth not he understand it? and he that keepeth thy soul, knoweth he it not? will he not also recompense every man according to his works?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, eat honey, for it is good, and the honey comb, for it is sweet unto thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul if thou find it, and there shall be an end, and thine hope shall not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay no wait, O wicked man, against the house of the righteous, and spoil not his resting place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth again: but the wicked fall into mischief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be thou not glad when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart rejoice when he stumbleth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest the Lord see it, and it displease him, and he turn his wrath from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fret not thyself because of the malicious, neither be envious at the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there shall be none end of plagues to the evil man, the light of the wicked shall be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, fear the Lord, and the King and meddle not with them that are seditious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their destruction shall rise suddenly, and who knoweth the ruin of them both?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also these things pertain to the wise, It is not good to have respect of any person in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that saith to the wicked, Thou art righteous, him shall the people curse, and the multitude shall abhor him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to them that rebuke him, shall be pleasure, and upon them shall come the blessing of goodness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall kiss the lips of him that answereth upright words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prepare thy work without, and make ready thy things in the field, and after, build thine house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not a witness against thy neighbor without cause: for wilt thou deceive with thy lips?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say not, I will do to him as he hath done to me, I will recompense every man according to his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I passed by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man destitute of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I beheld, and I considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So thy poverty cometh as one that traveleth by the way, and thy necessity like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are also parables of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah King of Judah copied out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of God is to conceal a thing secret: but the King’s honor is to search out a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heavens in height, and the earth in deepness: and the king’s heart can no man search out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the dross from the silver, and there shall proceed a vessel for the finer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take away the wicked from the King, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boast not thyself before the King, and stand not in the place of great men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is better, that it be said unto thee, Come up hither, than thou to be put lower in the presence of the Prince whom thine eyes have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go not forth hastily to strife, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbor hath put thee to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Debate thy matter with thy neighbor, and discover not the secret to another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest he that heareth it, put thee to shame, and thine infamy do not cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A word spoken in his place, is like apples of gold with pictures of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that reproveth the wise and the obedient ear, is as a golden earring, and an ornament of fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the cold of the snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that boasteth of false liberality, is like clouds and wind without rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Prince is pacified by staying of anger, and a soft tongue breaketh the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou have found honey, eat that is sufficient for thee, lest thou be overfull, and vomit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbor’s house, lest he be weary of thee, and hate thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbor, is like an hammer and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble, is like a broken tooth and a sliding foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that taketh away the garment in the cold season, is like vinegar poured upon nitre, or like him that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he that hateth thee be hungry, give him bread to eat, and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou shalt lay coals upon his head, and the Lord shall recompense thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Northwind driveth away the rain, so doth an angry countenance the slandering tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the house top, than with a contentious woman in a wide house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As are the cold waters to a weary soul, so is good news from a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A righteous man falling down before the wicked, is like a troubled well and a corrupt spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not good to eat much honey: so to search their own glory, is not glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that refraineth not his appetite, is like a city which is broken down and without walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the snow in the Summer, and as the rain in the Harvest are not meet, so is honor unseemly for a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sparrow by flying, and the swallow by flying escape, so the curse that is causeless, shall not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto the horse belongeth a whip, to the ass a bridle, and a rod to the fool’s back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Answer not a fool according to his foolishness, lest thou also be like him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Answer a fool according to his foolishness, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool, is as he that cutteth off the feet, and drinketh iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they that lift up the legs of the lame, so is a parable in a fool’s mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the closing up of a precious stone in an heap of stones, so is he that giveth glory to a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a thorn standing up in the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Excellent that formed all things, both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth the transgressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a dog turneth again to his own vomit, so a fool turneth to his foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? more hope is of a fool than of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful man saith, A lion is in the way: a lion is in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful man upon his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom, and it grieveth him to put it again to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit, than seven men that can render a reason.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that passeth by and medleth with the strife that belongeth not unto him, is as one that taketh a dog by the ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he that feigneth himself mad, casteth firebrands, arrows, and mortal things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So dealeth the deceitful man with his friend, and saith, Am not I in sport?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without wood the fire is quenched, and without a talebearer strife ceaseth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the coal maketh burning coals, and wood a fire, so the contentious man is apt to kindle strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of a talebearer are as flatterings, and they go down into the bowels of the belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As silver dross overlaid upon a potsherd, so are burning lips, and an evil heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hateth, will counterfeit with his lips, but in his heart he layeth up deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though he speak favorably, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hatred may be covered by deceit: but the malice thereof shall be discovered in the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that diggeth a pit shall fall therein, and he that rolleth a stone, it shall return unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false tongue hateth the afflicted, and a flattering mouth causeth ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boast not thyself of tomorrow, for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth: a stranger, and not thine own lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty: but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anger is cruel, and wrath is raging: but who can stand before envy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wounds of a lover are faithful, and the kisses of an enemy are pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person that is full, despiseth an honeycomb: but unto the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his own place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As ointment and perfume rejoice the heart, so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine own friend and thy father’s friend forsake thou not: neither enter into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbor that is near, than a brother far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, be wise, and rejoice mine heart, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prudent man seeth the plague, and hideth himself: but the foolish go on still, and are punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and a pledge of him for the stranger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that praiseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted to him as a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A continual dropping in the day of rain, and a contentious woman are alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hideth her, hideth the wind, and she is as the oil in his right hand that uttereth itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron sharpeneth iron, so doth man sharpen the face of his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that keepeth the fig tree, shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth upon his master, shall come to honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grave and destruction can never be full, so the eyes of man can never be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As is the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold, so is every man according to his dignity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat brayed with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be diligent to know the state of thy flock, and take heed to the herds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For riches remain not always, nor the crown from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hay discovereth itself, and the grass appeareth, and the herbs of the mountains are gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let the milk of the goats be sufficient for thy food, for the food of thy family, and for the sustenance of thy maids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked flee when none pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the transgression of the land there are many princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge a realm likewise endureth long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A poor man, if he oppress the poor, is like a raging rain that leaveth no food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that forsake the Law, praise the wicked: but they that keep the Law, set themselves against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wicked men understand not judgment: but they that seek the Lord, understand all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that perverteth his ways, though he be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that keepeth the Law, is a child of understanding: but he that feedeth the gluttons, shameth his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that increaseth his riches by usury and interest, gathereth them for him that will be merciful unto the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the Law, even his prayer shall be abominable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that causeth the righteous to go astray by an evil way, shall fall into his own pit, and the upright shall inherit good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man is wise in his own conceit: but the poor that hath understanding, can try him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When righteous men rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked come up, the man is tried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hideth his sins, shall not prosper: but he that confesseth, and forsaketh them, shall have mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is the man that feareth always: but he that hardeneth his heart, shall fall into evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a roaring lion, and an hungry bear, so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prince destitute of understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness, shall prolong his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that doeth violence against the blood of a person, shall flee unto the grave, and they shall not stay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is froward in his ways, shall once fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that tilleth his land, shall be satisfied with bread, but he that followeth the idle, shall be filled with poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A faithful man shall abound in blessings, and he that maketh haste to be rich, shall not be innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To have respect of persons is not good: for that man will transgress for a piece of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man with a wicked eye hasteth to riches, and knoweth not that poverty shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that rebuketh a man, shall find more favor at the length, than he that flattereth with his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that robbeth his father and mother, and saith, It is no transgression, is the companion of a man that destroyeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is of a proud heart, stirreth up strife: but he that trusteth in the Lord, shall be fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that trusteth in his own heart, is a fool: but he that walketh in wisdom, shall be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that giveth unto the poor, shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes, shall have many curses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wicked rise up, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that hardeneth his neck when he is rebuked, shall suddenly be destroyed, and cannot be cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that feedeth harlots wasteth his substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A king by judgment maintaineth the country: but a man receiving gifts, destroyeth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that flattereth his neighbor, spreadeth a net for his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the transgression of an evil man is his snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous knoweth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a wise man contend with a foolish man, whether he be angry or laugh, there is no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bloody men hate him that is upright: but the just have care of his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool poureth out all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a prince that hearkeneth to lies, all his servants are wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor and the usurer meet together, and the Lord lightened both their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A King that judgeth the poor in truth, his throne shall be established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rod and correction give wisdom, but a child set at liberty, maketh his mother ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wicked are increased, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Correct thy son, and he will give thee rest, and will give pleasures to thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where there is no vision, the people decay: but he that keepeth the law is blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A servant will not be chastised with words: though he understand, yet he will not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seest thou a man hasty in his matters? there is more hope of a fool, than of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from youth, at length he will be even as his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pride of a man shall bring him low: but the humble in spirit shall enjoy glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is partner with a thief, hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing and declareth it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but he that trusteth in the Lord shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many do seek the face of the ruler: but every man’s judgment cometh from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked man is abomination to the just, and he that is upright in his way, is abomination to the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophecy which the man spake unto Ithiel, even to Ithiel, and Ucal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely I am more foolish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not learned wisdom, nor attained to the knowledge of holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath ascended up to heaven, and descended? Who hath gathered the wind in his fist? Who hath bound the waters in a garment? Who hath established all the ends of the world? What is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou canst tell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield to those that trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put nothing unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two things have I required of thee: deny me them not before I die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me not poverty, nor riches: feed me with food convenient for me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the Lord? or lest I be poor and steal, and take the Name of my God in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, when thou hast offended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation that are pure in their own conceit, and yet are not washed from their filthiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation whose eyes are haughty, and their eye lids are lifted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their chaws as knives to eat up the afflicted out of the earth, and the poor from among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The horseleech hath two daughters which cry, Give, give. There be three things that will not be satisfied: yea, four that say not, It is enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grave, and the barren womb, the earth, that cannot be satisfied with water, and the fire that saith not, It is enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye that mocketh his father and despiseth the instruction of his mother, let the ravens of the valley pick it out, and the young eagles eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There be three things hid from me: yea, four that I know not:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of an eagle in the air, the way of a serpent upon a stone, the way of a ship in the midst of the sea, and the way of a man with a maid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such is the way also of an adulterous woman: she eateth and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have not committed iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For three things the earth is moved: yea, for four it cannot sustain itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a servant when he reigneth, and a fool when he is filled with meat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the hateful woman, when she is married, and for a handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These be four small things in the earth, yet they are wise, and full of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pismires a people not strong, yet prepare they their meat in summer:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The conies a people not mighty, yet make they their houses in the rock:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grasshopper hath no king, yet go they forth all by bands:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in king’s palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There be three things that order well their going: yea, four are comely in going:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A lion which is strong among beasts, and turneth not at the sight of any:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A lusty greyhound, and a goat, and a king against whom there is no rising up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou hast been foolish in lifting thyself up, and if thou hast thought wickedly, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one churneth milk, he bringeth forth butter: and he that wringeth his nose, causeth blood to come out, so he that forceth wrath, bringeth forth strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: THE WORDS OF KING LEMUEL: The prophecy which his mother taught him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What my son! and what the son of my womb! and what, O son of my desires!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways which is to destroy kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for princes strong drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest he drink and forget the decree, and change the judgment of all the children of affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give ye strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto them that have grief of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him drink, that he may forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all the children of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and judge the afflicted, and the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shall find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above the pearls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of her husband trusteth in her, and he shall have no need of spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She will do him good, and not evil all the days of her life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She seeketh wool and flax, and laboreth cheerfully with her hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is like the ships of merchants: she bringeth her food from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she ariseth, while it is yet night: and giveth the portion to her household, and the ordinary to her maids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She considereth a field, and getteth it: and with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She feeleth that her merchandise is good: her candle is not put out by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She putteth her hands to the wheel, and her hands handle the spindle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor, and putteth forth her hands to the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She feareth not the snow for her family: for all her family is clothed with scarlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She maketh herself carpets: fine linen and purple is her garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth with the Elders of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She maketh sheets, and selleth them, and giveth girdles unto the merchant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strength and honor is her clothing, and in the latter day she shall rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She openeth her mouth with wisdom, and the law of grace is in her tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She overseeth the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her children rise up, and call her blessed: her husband also shall praise her, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many daughters have done virtuously: but thou surmountest them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Favor is deceitful, and beauty is vanity: but a woman that feareth the Lord she shall be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands, and let her own works praise her in the gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator
